abstract.p: Ellie Harold letter disputes Claudia Dreifus' April 9 travel article on Puerto Rico's Vieques Island

block.p: To the Editor: As one who covets the relatively undeveloped aspect of my island retreat, I winced when I saw your recent article on Vieques. While locals and visitors alike agree that Cafe Blu is snob city, Ms. Dreifus is the first person I know of who's been even slightly disappointed by a meal at La Campesina. And the setting, amid jungle flora where each evening a chorus of coquis serenades diners, can't be beat.

And at one of Esperanza's funky mainstays, Bananas, you can get delicious jerked chicken with red beans and rice, as well as a great bacon cheeseburger, spicy chicken wings and cheap local beer. The view of the Caribbean from there is spectacular, and it's a place to meet locals and tourists alike.
